thread.title: IPL auction: World No. 1 T20 bowler Imran Tahir goes unsold
thread.title_full: IPL auction: World No. 1 T20 bowler Imran Tahir goes unsold

author: DECCAN CHRONICLE.
title: IPL auction: World No. 1 T20 bowler Imran Tahir goes unsold
text:
Imran Tahir has picked 29 wickets in IPL at an average of 21.48 with an economy rate of 8.61. (Photo: BCCI) Bengaluru: One of the biggest shocks of the ongoing 2017 Indian Premier League (IPL) player’s auction was world No. 1 bowler in ODIs and T20Is Imran Tahir going unsold.
Follow: Live IPL 2017 Players Auction: Tymal, Ben Stokes earn big; Ishant, Tahir go unsold
The South African leggie’s name came up for the auction in the fifth set, but to everyone’s surprise, the veteran was not picked by any of the IPL sides.
Tahir has earlier played for Delhi Darevils in IPL. The veteran featured in the domestic T20 league from 2014-2016. In 20 matches for DD, Tahir picked 29 wickets at an average of 21.48 with an economy rate of 8.61.
Read: IPL auction: Ben Stokes bought by Rising Pune Supergiants for Rs.14.5 crore
 Tahir has played 31 T20Is for South Africa, picking 54 wickets at an average of 13.70 and a meagre economy rate of 6.38. In 70 ODIs, he has picked 121 wickets at an average of 23.55 and an economy rate 4.63.
